South Africa survive and have still never lost a T20 to Bangladesh.
The pitch conditions at Eisenhower Park were challenging, making a target of 114 difficult to chase.
Bangladesh only managed four runs off the bat in the last over.
Maharaj bowled three full tosses in the final over, but Bangladesh did not find the boundary off any of them. South Africa have three wins from three and are pretty much through.
Alex Hartley, Former England bowler on BBC Sounds: 'It's just tough for both sides to bat on this pitch and every game we've had have been low-scoring thrillers.'
South Africa's top three batters have collectively scored 61 runs in nine trips to the crease at an average of 6.77.
South Africa have only lost their first four wickets by end of the fifth over on five occasions in men's T20Is, and two of them came in this competition.
The pitch received criticism but provided thrilling matches.
Samuel Kirkwood: 'Whoever decided on that rule needs to be sacked. Can say what you like but at end of day those 4 runs have cost Bangladesh. At very least ball should be re-bowled.'
The match was played in front of a large crowd of 22,658 spectators at Eisenhower Park, predominantly supporting Bangladesh.
David Miller celebrated his 35th birthday during the match.
The match took place in New York.
The match was held in New York at Eisenhower Park.
The match was held at Nassau County International Cricket Stadium, New York.
